version_description:
- Edit Sleep Notes of previous sleep sessions.
- Change the set alarm time during active sleep session.
- Turn off or restart Sleep Aid during active sleep session.
- Weather feature reactivated.
- New design for setting alarm.
- Various fi

* Fixed a SleepSecure issue
* General stability and performance improvements

After two years of extensive research and testing, Sleep Cycle introduces:

Patented Sound Analysis Sleep Tracking

ELIMINATING THE NEED FOR PHONES IN BED
New groundbreaking sound analysis technology with a new patented intelligent algorith

5.0.1

Fixed an issue where existing paying users did not get Premium for free automatically (forever).
Important bug fixes and improvements.

5.0:

After two years of extensive research and testing, Sleep Cycle introduces:

Pat
Bug fixes and improvements

- iPad support! With this update, iPad users can finally wake up as happy as iPhone users.

- New graph! Sleep quality affected by location. Get new insights on how the location affects your sleep quality.

- ’Dont show again' button on the ni

- Fixed Health app integration. We’re sending “time asleep” to Health app again.
- Stability and performance improvements.
- Stability and performance improvements.

- New trend graph shows how the moon cycle affects your sleep quality
- Phillips HUE updates including support for Phillips HUE 2.0.
- New alarm melodies and ambient alarm sounds
- Bug fixes and stability improvements

Added new languages: Russian, Turkish, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil) and Chinese (Tr.).
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.

Adjusted automatic microphone calibration for users switching to new devices.
Fixed minor translation defects.
Additional bug fixes and improvements.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
Bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes and improvements.

INTRODUCING SNORE DETECTION

Maybe you snore. Maybe you don’t. But a third of the adult population do. Despite getting a full night’s sleep, they don’t know why they’re tired or annoyed, anxious or deprived. But that’s what poor sleep does to you, a
Snore detection implemented in Trends. With the latest release, Sleep Cycle does not only detect, measure, and track your snoring - it also gives you historical snore data in the Premium Trends view.
Bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes and improvements
New optimizations for iPhone X and iPhone 8, including improved heart rate reading and support to keep device face up during night.

Adaptations for iOS 11 and iPhone X.
Bug fixes and improvements.
New optimizations for iPhone X and iPhone 8, including improved heart rate reading and support to keep device face up during night.

To snoozers and snorers delight, we introduce Sleep Cycle Apple Watch App.

No more snore. The new Watch App gently nudges your wrist when it detects snoring. The gentle nudge will not cause you to wake up, but it will have you change position witho

为了让贪睡的人和打鼾的人更好地睡眠，我们推出了 Sleep Cycle Apple Watch 应用。

不再打鼾。当检测到打鼾时，新款 Apple Watch 应用可轻推手腕，这种温柔的轻推不会让您醒来，但会让您在不知不觉中改变睡姿，停止打鼾。没有打鼾，意味着更好的睡眠质量。

您可以准时起床，不会打扰到家人，让他们安心无虞。Sleep Cycle Apple Watch 应用具有无声唤醒功能。可通过手腕上的无声触击将您唤醒，不会给家人造成干扰。

直指问题核心。Sl
Minor bug fixes and improvements.
This release contains the usual tricks and fixes that make Sleep Cycle slightly better than before. Even a bug hunt deserves an update, after all.

Our Sleep Aid content is now available for everyone. While the content remains in English still, you can just enter the Sleep Aid world now and flip a switch (it's right there, you can't miss it) and it's all yours, no matter your language or nationality.
Bug fixes and improvements.
In this we release, we fixed a crash issue in the payments screen and tweaked a few minor things with handling expired subscriptions.
This release addresses issues when creating an account.
Some minor bug fixes.

We continuously work on improving stability and correcting any bugs that we might find in Sleep Cycle, whilst simultaneously doing our best not to introduce any new defects... we believe this release is a step in the right direction.
Fixes issues we've had with our onboarding process plus other bug fixes
Bug fixes and improvements.
We regularly work on improving the stability and performance of our app... By time, all these minor fixes adds up to a release that's worthy to proclaim it contains: "Bug fixes and improvements".
Minor bug fixes and improvements.

We finally dared to look into the eyes of our sound analysis engine, and we came to mutual agreement that it could be improved. So we have, and you’ll find that we’ve reduced battery consumption overnight, significantly.
Since we’re on a roll, we also

In this release, we’re now supporting the new iPhone XS Max, the iPhone XR and the Watch Series 4, not to mention the updated WatchOS 5 for all devices. That’s a lot of numbers and letters, but the magic of waking up at the right time, remains.

Fixed issue affecting heart rate measurements using the camera.
Additional bug fixes and improvements.
Bug fixes and improvements
In this release, we've mostly squashed bugs and worked on stability. Even a bug deserves a good night's sleep, after all.
Minor bug fixes and improvements.

亲爱的朋友们，该版本做出了重大的改进，我们对整体视觉进行了重新设计，其设定了未来的标准。不必担心，它仍是原来的应用程序，并具备相同功能。只是变漂亮了好多。而且准备好提供更棒的睡前准备工作。
In this release, we squashed a few pesky bugs involving the alarm volume and battery monitoring, and made some other minor improvements in various sections.
In this release, we squashed a few pesky bugs involving the onboarding process and made some other minor improvements in various sections.
Some minor bug fixes.
This release addresses issues when creating an account.
In this we release, we fixed a crash issue in the payments screen and tweaked a few minor things with handling expired subscriptions.

- Fixed weekend mode not working properly
- Fixed online backup sync issues for older devices
- Fixed a problem with alarm not sounding after snoozing sometimes
- Fixed crash due to audio recording format problems
- And some minor tweaks, fixe
Fixes issues we've had with our onboarding process plus other bug fixes
Fixes issues we've had with our onboarding process plus other bug fixes

We continuously work on improving stability and correcting any bugs that we might find in Sleep Cycle, whilst simultaneously doing our best not to introduce any new defects... we believe this release is a step in the right direction.

- Fixed Sleep Aid selection defect
- Stability fixes and improvements
- Corrected some missing translations
- And some other minor fixes and adjustments
Bug fixes and improvements.

Now is the time for regularity. Sleep regularity, that is. To measure your time to bed, your time to rise, and how it might impact the quality of your sleep. And if you didn’t already know, regularity is one of the single most important factors for better

Now is the time for regularity. Sleep regularity, that is. To measure your time to bed, your time to rise, and how it might impact the quality of your sleep. And if you didn’t already know, regularity is one of the single most important factors for better

This is one of Sleep Cycle’s most ambitious releases yet, our new Sleep Aid program. You’re welcome to our world of stories on kitchen sunsets or lighthouses by the sea. Follow our relaxing guides to a quiet grove or a white beach under pastel skies, or e

This is one of Sleep Cycle’s most ambitious releases yet, our new Sleep Aid program. You’re welcome to our world of stories on kitchen sunsets or lighthouses by the sea. Follow our relaxing guides to a quiet grove or a white beach under pastel skies, or e
New improved Sleep Notes! Tap the Info button in our now greatly expanded view of Sleep Notes, to learn more about how to improve your sleep by understanding your habits.

Our Sleep Aid content is now available for everyone. While the content remains in English still, you can just enter the Sleep Aid world now and flip a switch (it's right there, you can't miss it) and it's all yours, no matter your language or nationality.

Our Sleep Aid content is now available for everyone. While the content remains in English still, you can just enter the Sleep Aid world now and flip a switch (it's right there, you can't miss it) and it's all yours, no matter your language or nationality.

- Sleep Aid content now fully streamable with instant listening
- Average chart line brought back in statistics
- Fixed an issue where fall asleep time was incorrectly estimated
- Resolved a bug where the wrong time asleep value was exported to H

- More gentle alarm volume during wake-up
- Revamped critical battery warning
- Plus a multitude of minor fixes and improvements
It took us awhile. But now it's here. Welcome, Siri. Say hello to Shortcuts.
Fixes an issue with the alarm volume being way too low, which some users experienced.
Bug fixes and improvements

- New improved partner link interface and options
- Fixed an issue with bluetooth connected audio devices (iOS 13.4 required)
- And a few other minor tweaks and fixes
Bugfixes and improvements
Bugfixes and improvements

Your sleep data is alive. From now on, we'll offer you insights in the journal on anything and everything regarding your sleep.
We also corrected an issue with vibrate on snooze, as well as some additional bug fixes and improvements.
The Apple Watch app is back. Now, it’s stand-alone. Go explore. You’ll love it, we’re sure.

If you're curious on sleep, we now have a sleep training program. A couple of e-mails for everyone that want some help to sleep better. So far, it's English only but still available for any user, no matter your language settings.

If you're curious on sleep, we now have a sleep training program. A couple of e-mails for everyone that want some help to sleep better. So far, it's English only but still available for any user, no matter your language settings.

- Fix for time in bed discrepancy when using Apple Watch
- Fix for missing journal behavior when using Apple Watch Series 3 or older
- Corrected several performance issues related to insights
- Resolved "hanging" behavior in phone app after using
Not all updates move the mountains. This one’s about fixing the small stuff required to do so, though.
Bugfixes and minor improvements
Bugfixes and minor improvements

We’re now able to detect some sleep talking, spoken words, coughing and perhaps even a fussy baby, while you sleep. You’ll find a selection of this where snoring is in the journal. We also refined the Apple Watch UI a bit.
Some minor bugs have been squashed.
